go_data.justification: Archaeal transcription initiation requires only two accessory proteins bound to DNA: transcription factor B (TFB) and TATA-box binding protein (TBP).
TFB is an accessory protein bound to DNA during transcription initiation in Archaea.
None, however, the archaeal transcription machinery is orthologous to that of eukaryotes, thus TFB is likely located in the nucleoid or equivalent structure in Archaea.
